definition: to work together
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]
public utility/state-run enterprise/public foundation or enterprise, often charitable

sentences.english: Practically all have been with him for years, some for decades.
sentences.chinese: 几乎所有这些人都和他共事多年，有的已经几十年了。

sentences.english: It gives me great pleasure to introduce Dr.Robert Dundee, who will be with us for two years.
sentences.chinese: 我很荣幸介绍罗伯，丹迪博士，他将与我们共事两年。

sentences.english: Palm Basic is a utility written for the Palm series of handheld devices.
sentences.chinese: 基本的棕榈是为手扶的设备棕榈系列写的公共事业。

sentences.english: They clearly enjoy working with him and with Shakespeare.
sentences.chinese: 他们显然很喜欢和他共事莎翁的名剧。

sentences.english: I don't mind working with other people actually.
sentences.chinese: 实际上我不介意和其他人共事。

sentences.english: Both the staff and the students were great to work with.
sentences.chinese: 这里的全体教工和学生都是优秀的共事人才。

sentences.english: Public works, digging ditches, war has the same effect.
sentences.chinese: 公共事业，开河挖沟，发动战争都有同样的效果。

sentences.english: Currently, however, only small number of utilities have partnered directly with Google.
sentences.chinese: 然而，目前只有少数的公共事业设备直接与谷歌合作。

sentences.english: We'll miss doing business with you.
sentences.chinese: 我们会吊唁和你一起共事的韶光。

sentences.english: And the other professor I am working with is professor Schmidt.
sentences.chinese: 另一个和我一起共事的教授是施密特教授。

sentences.english: Make innovation a common cause, for the greater good of all.
sentences.chinese: 要让创新成为一种为更大的整体造福的公共事业。

sentences.english: You are a dream to work with.
sentences.chinese: 能够与你共事，是我梦寐以求的事情。

sentences.english: No one like to deal with a pawky person.
sentences.chinese: 没有谁喜欢和狡猾的人共事。

sentences.english: Both Locke and Chu have had experience working with the Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 骆家辉和朱棣文都曾和中国人一起共事。

sentences.english: And this is absolutely an extraordinary opportunity for us to share this moment with them.
sentences.chinese: 对我们来说能和他们一起共事是个极好的机会。

sentences.english: Working with a boss who knows how to delegate and who does delegate.
sentences.chinese: 同一个知道分配任务并确实分配任务的上司共事。

definition: to be in contact (with sb)/to associate/to interact/to get along (well, poorly)
personal friendship
to associate (with)/to have contact (with)/to hang out (with)/to date/(interpersonal) relationship/association/contact
friendship/friendly relations
to give one's bare heart into sb else's keeping (idiom); sb has one's absolute confidence/to trust completely/to confide in sb with entire sincerity
to get to know each other/acquaintance
to have an in depth conversation/to have intimate talks/to discuss thoroughly
shared delights and common hardships (idiom); to share life's joys and sorrows/for better or for worse
congenial
very friendly/intimate
intersection (symbol ∩) (set theory)
to come into contact with/to have dealings
to make friends with
candid/frank/plain dealing
from the cradle to the grave (idiom); to go through fire and water/brave/willing to risk life and limb
a long talk
